column2: NEW JERSEY DMV PERMIT TEST
column4: New Jersey
column6: NJ

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. What should you do if one of your tires blows out?
column4: Hold the steering wheel tight and brake immediately to avoid the risk of skidding.
column6: Hold the steering wheel tight and slowly take your foot off the gas pedal.
column10: Decrease speed, pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other vehicles.

column2: 2. This sign tells drivers that:
column4: they must stay on the right side of the divider
column6: there is a right turn ahead.
column10: there is a reduction of lanes ahead.

column2: 3. This sign means:
column4: The center lane is shared for left turns.
column6: Left turns in both directions of travel are not permitted.

column2: 4. Which of the following is NOT true about ABS?
column4: It helps increase your stopping distance.
column6: It improves the steering ability.

column2: 5. This regulatory sign tells drivers that:
column4: traffic in the right lane must go straight.
column6: all vehicles must turn left immediately.
column8: traffic in the left lane must turn left at the intersection ahead.

column2: 6. This road sign means:
column4: You must make a complete stop
column6: Slow down or stop
column10: Yield the right-of-way to oncoming vehicles

column2: 7. This road sign means:
column4: Left turns are not allowed where this sign is displayed.
column6: Drivers cannot make a complete turn to go in the opposite direction.
column8: Vehicles turning left must make a U-turn.

column2: 8. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: the road will make a sharp turn to the right.
column6: left turns are not allowed at the intersection.
column8: another traffic lane joins the one they are on.
column10: another road enters the highway from the direction shown.

column2: 9. When driving near light rail vehicles, drivers should:
column4: never drive around lowered crossing gates.
column6: always obey signs and traffic signals.
column8: expect trains on any track at any time.

column2: 10. A driver approaching a flashing red traffic signal must:
column4: carefully drive through the intersection without stopping.
column6: merge to the left.
column8: slow down at the traffic signal.

column2: 11. You go with a group of friends to a social event, and you plan to have a few drinks. You should:
column4: stop drinking several minutes before you intend to leave.
column6: avoid alternating between drinks with alcohol and drinks without any alcohol.
column8: make alcohol the focus of the event.
column10: arrange to ride home with a friend who does not drink.

column2: 12. What does the pictured signal indicate?
column4: A pedestrian may begin crossing the street.
column6: Pedestrians may turn right.
column8: A pedestrian may not not begin crossing the street.
column10: Drivers should walk more and drive less.

column2: 13. When following a motorcycle, drivers must remember that motorcycles can ____________ than other vehicles.
column4: accelerate much faster
column6: stop much more quickly

column2: 14. Regulation signs normally are ____ rectangles with ____ letters or symbols.
column4: white; black
column6: green; white

column2: 15. A flashing yellow light means:
column4: The light will soon change from green to red.
column6: Yield the right-of-way to other traffic at the intersection.

column2: 16. If the entrance lane is too short to allow acceleration to expressway speed, you should:
column4: enter the expressway and accelerate quickly.
column6: accelerate to expressway speed and blend with traffic.
column8: reduce your speed to 15 MPH or less and blend with traffic.
column10: stop and wait for a large space in traffic.

column2: 17. Aggressive driving behaviors can include:
column4: excessive speed
column6: excessive following distance.

column2: 18. This sign warns drivers of:
column4: a cross road.
column6: a side road.

column2: 19. This road sign means:
column4: Right turn permitted on red light
column6: No U-turns

column2: 20. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: drivers in the left lane have the right-of-way
column6: there is a one lane bridge ahead.

column2: 21. How many different  classes of mopeds are there?
22. This road sign:
column4: is a no-right-turns sign.
column6: warns drivers that U-turns are not permitted.
column8: warns drivers of a sharp turn left. Drivers should slow their speed and keep to the left.
column10: provides an advance notice of a roundabout.

column2: 23. Drivers should be aware that a motorcyclist may:
column4: decrease speed and rise off the seat when approaching a railroad crossing.
column6: move to the center of the lane on steel deck bridges.
column8: quickly change speed or lane position.

column2: 24. Which shape is a railroad advance warning sign?
column4: Round
column6: Pentagon

column2: 25. When drivers come to this sign, they must:
column4: brake sharply and come to a complete stop.
column6: be ready to stop at the stop sign.
column8: warn other drivers that a stop sign is ahead.
column10: stop doing what they are doing.

column2: 26. This sign means:
column4: Stay on the main highway if possible
column6: Not enter
column10: The road to the right is for one-way traffic only

column2: 27. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: another road enters the highway from the direction shown.
column6: right turns are not allowed.
column10: the road will make a sharp turn to the right.

column2: 28. Drivers often fail to see a motorcycle headed toward them. Why?
column4: Motorcycles are hard to see.
column6: It is difficult to judge a motorcycle's speed.
column8: It is  hard to judge how far away a motorcycle is.

column2: 29. What should you do as you prepare to turn right at an intersection?
column4: Honk your horn.
column6: Yield to bicyclists coming from the opposite direction.
column8: Signal your turn, check for bicyclists, and do not turn directly in front of a bicyclist.

column2: 30. A driver who approaches an intersection:
column4: has the right-of-way over traffic already in the intersection.
column6: must yield the right-of-way to traffic already in the intersection.
column8: must drive straight through the intersection, even if another vehicle is already in the intersection.

column2: 31. Which of the following does NOT affect the distance that it takes to stop your vehicle?
column4: Steering ability.
column6: Braking distance.

column2: 32. As you approach an intersection, the traffic light changes from green to yellow. You should:
column4: speed up to beat the red light.
column6: be prepared to stop in the middle of the intersection.
column8: apply the brakes sharply and come to a complete stop.
column10: be prepared to stop before the intersection.

column2: 33. What is the meaning of blue traffic signs?
column4: They give directional information.
column6: Blue indicates road user services.
column8: Blue indicates pedestrian crossings and school zones.
column10: A blue background indicates a regulatory sign.

column2: 34. Which of the following must you obey over the others?
column4: Stop sign
column6: Red light

column2: 35. In New Jersey, drivers under 21 years of age are considered under the influence (DUI) when their BAC is:
36. This is the shape and color of a ________ sign.
column4: yield
column6: wrong Way

column2: 37. Double solid yellow lines mean:
column4: the lane to the right may pass.
column6: passing is permitted in either direction.
column8: the lane to the left may pass.
column10: passing is not permitted in either direction.

column2: 38. When meeting a car with blinding headlights, you should:
column4: look toward the left side of the road.
column6: dim your lights, then speed up and pass quickly.
column8: look toward the right side of the road.
column10: use your emergency flashers to warn the other driver.

column2: 39. When a ‘Road Closed’ sign is displayed, drivers must:
column4: come to a complete stop and wait for the lights to turn green.
column6: look for a detour or another route.
column10: remove the sign and move forward.

column2: 40. Which of the following drugs could affect your ability to drive?
column4: A cold remedy.
column6: Tranquilizers.

column2: 41. Alcohol:
column4: increases reaction time.
column6: makes it difficult for drivers to judge their condition.
column8: makes drivers more prone to take chances.

column2: 42. The sign in the picture:
column4: is used to advise motorists of the appropriate ramp speed at the highway exit point.
column6: indicates the minimum ramp speed at the highway exit point.
column8: shows the highest speed drivers can travel at the exit of the intersection.

column2: 43. This road sign means:
column4: Trucks under 12,000 lbs. allowed
column6: Truck stop ahead

column2: 44. When you make a left turn from a one-way road into a one-way road, if the road you enter has two lanes, you:
column4: must go to the next intersection.
column6: must turn into its right lane.
column8: must turn into its left lane.

column2: 45. This road sign means:
column4: You are about to enter a one-way street the wrong way
column6: You may proceed only if the way is clear

column2: 46. If you drink alcohol socially, what helps insure safe driving?
column4: Drink coffee before driving.
column6: Ride home with a friend who has not been drinking.
column8: Stop drinking one hour before driving.
column10: Take a cold shower before driving.

column2: 47. Who has a greater risk of being involved in a traffic crash?
column4: Drivers who are driving alone.
column6: Young people.

column2: 48. What type of pavement marking shows you which lane you must use for a turn?
column4: Arrows
column6: Crosswalk Lines

column2: 49. If an approaching driver does not dim the headlights, you should:
column4: flash your headlights to low beam for a second, then return to high beam.
column6: move your eyes to the left to help avoid the glare of approaching high beams.
column8: flash your headlights to high beam for a second, then return to low beam.

column2: 50. This warning sign:
column4: indicates the suggested highest safe speed.
column6: provides advance notice to upcoming speed limit change.
column8: shows the current speed limit that all vehicles traveling in the direction of the arrow must not exceed.
column10: tells drivers that the minimum safe speed is 45 MPH.
